keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.Khiops

Class Khiops

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.Basic.Discretizer
      • keel.Algorithms.Discretizers.Khiops.Khiops

  • public class Khiops
extends Discretizer
    Khiops Discretizer Implemented by Julian Luengo, March 2010 julianlm@decsai.ugr.es Based on the work of Marc Boullé M. Boulle. Khiops: A Statistical Discretization Method of Continuous Attributes Machine Learning 55:1 (2004) 53-69

    Since:
    JDK 1.5

    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Written by Julián Luengo Martín 18/03/2010

    • Method Detail

      • discretizeAttribute

        protected java.util.Vector discretizeAttribute(int attribute,
                                               int[] values,
                                               int begin,
                                               int end)
        Description copied from class: Discretizer
        This abstract method creates the cut points of the attribute given using its values for each instances given. Every discretizer should implement this method with its particular scheme.
        Specified by:
        discretizeAttribute in class Discretizer
        Parameters:
        attribute - given attribute to discretize.
        values - given attribute values in the dataset.
        begin - First position of the section to discretize.
        end - Last position of the section to discretize.
        Returns:
        the cut points of the attribute given

      • mergeCostVariation

        public double mergeCostVariation(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> na,
                                 int indexna,
                                 double naChi2,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> nb,
                                 int indexnb,
                                 double nbChi2,
                                 int[] values)
        Computes the cost derived form merging two adjacent intervals na and nb
        Parameters:
        na - Interval to the left to merge
        indexna - Index of the first element of na in the whole list of real values
        naChi2 - number of intervals
        nb - Right interval to merge
        indexnb - Index of the first element of nb in the whole list of real values
        nbChi2 - Current number of intervals (the total intervals prior to the merging)
        values - Array in which position i there is the number of instance which explanatory (real) value has rank i after sorting
        Returns:
        The cost variation produced by the merge operation

      • chi2RowValues

        public double chi2RowValues(java.util.Vector disc,
                            int[] values)
        Creates the initial chi square value of the initial discretization scheme. It also initialize the contribution to this value of each interval, so the combination of intervals can be quickly evaluated.
        Parameters:
        disc - the initial discretization scheme (one interval for each different value)
        values - the global array of values (sorted)
        Returns:
        the chi square value for the initial discretization scheme

      • mergedRowChi2Value

        public double mergedRowChi2Value(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> mergedInterval,
                                 int index,
                                 int[] values)
        This method calculates the contribution to the global chi square value of a new interval (produced by merging two adjacent ones).
        Parameters:
        mergedInterval - the new interval
        index - the index of the first element (left-most one) value in the global array of values
        values - the global array of values
        Returns:
        the contribution of this new interval to the global chi square value

      • createCP

        public java.util.Vector createCP(java.util.Vector intervals)
        Construct an array of cutpoints from the set of intervals.
        Parameters:
        intervals - Vector which contains the intervals in ArrayList format
        Returns:
        A Vector with double formatted cutpoints, computed as the midterm between two adjacent intervals.
